result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*Court waives all non mandatory costs due to defendant's income.
*Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 8/15/2018, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 13 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work and child care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stanley Breyon Bickham

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet.  vp
Bail Notice mailed to surety on 08/17/17.  vp

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 13 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work and child care.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court waives all non mandatory costs due to defendant's income.

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 8/15/2018, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Charles Robert Roozen in court, defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham not in court, in custody.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Defense counsel requests more time to review. Parties are advised effective July 29, 2017 case is assigned to Judge Kashoua Kristy Yang in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Charles Robert Roozen in court, defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham not in court, in custody.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Charles Robert Roozen in court, defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham not in court, in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
BRANCH 10 for BRANCH 47.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court reminders.

Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Case is adjourned to Br. 10 for Branch 47.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety. DZ

Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin./LNR  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham not in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeded.  Surety, failing to appear, court orders cash bail to remain forfeited.

Defendant Stanley Breyon Bickham in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
